type.requirement: Interoperable Taxonomy Architecture (ITA) initiative requirement for alignment of the EDINET, IFRS and US GAAP taxonomies.
type.definition: The domain member item type indicates that an element is a domain member.

type.requirement: Interoperable Taxonomy Architecture (ITA) initiative requirement for alignment of the EDINET, IFRS and US GAAP taxonomies.
type.definition: escapedItemType specializes string. There is no constraint on whether the resulting unescaped content is well-formed or not; this base type is exists so that processors know what to do with the content. It is a suitable base type for a data type whose unescaped content must be valid HTML 4.0 (which is not XML).

type.requirement: Interoperable Taxonomy Architecture (ITA) initiative requirement for alignment of the EDINET, IFRS and US GAAP taxonomies.
type.definition: xmlNodesItemType specializes escapedItemType. The unescaped content MUST be a sequence of XML text and well-formed XML nodes. This content constraint cannot be captured by a finite length regular expression.

type.requirement: Interoperable Taxonomy Architecture (ITA) initiative requirement for alignment of the EDINET, IFRS and US GAAP taxonomies.
type.definition: xmlItemType specializes xmlNodesItemType. The unescaped content MUST be well formed XML. This is a suitable base type for the SEC EDGAR “text block” item type which must conform to an EDGAR-specific XML Schema or DTD.

type.requirement: Interoperable Taxonomy Architecture (ITA) initiative requirement for alignment of the EDINET, IFRS and US GAAP taxonomies.
type.definition: textBlockItemType specializes xmlNodesItemType. The unescaped content MUST have mixed content containing a simple string, or a fragment of XHTML or a mixture of both.

type.requirement: Interoperable Taxonomy Architecture (ITA) initiative requirement for alignment of the EDINET, IFRS and US GAAP taxonomies.
type.definition: The percent item type is used to indicate that the value of the element is intended to be presented as a percentage. This does not contravene Specification section 4.8.2, which requires that percentages not be multiplied by 100.

type.requirement: Interoperable Taxonomy Architecture (ITA) initiative requirement for alignment of the EDINET, IFRS and US GAAP taxonomies.
type.definition: The per share item type indicates a monetary amount divided by a number of shares. The per share item type has a Decimal base.

type.requirement: Interoperable Taxonomy Architecture (ITA) initiative requirement for alignment of the EDINET, IFRS and US GAAP taxonomies.
type.definition: The area item type is used to indicate that an element represents an area.

type.requirement: Interoperable Taxonomy Architecture (ITA) initiative requirement for alignment of the EDINET, IFRS and US GAAP taxonomies.
type.definition: The Volume item type is used to indicate that an element represents a volume and can be used to express the volume of any substance, whether solid, liquid, or gas.

type.requirement: Interoperable Taxonomy Architecture (ITA) initiative requirement for alignment of the EDINET, IFRS and US GAAP taxonomies.
type.definition: The mass item type represents the mass of an object which can be measured.

type.requirement: Interoperable Taxonomy Architecture (ITA) initiative requirement for alignment of the EDINET, IFRS and US GAAP taxonomies.
type.definition: The weight item type represents the weight of an object which can be measured.

type.requirement: Interoperable Taxonomy Architecture (ITA) initiative requirement for alignment of the EDINET, IFRS and US GAAP taxonomies.
type.definition: The energy item type represents a unit of energy.

type.requirement: Interoperable Taxonomy Architecture (ITA) initiative requirement for alignment of the EDINET, IFRS and US GAAP taxonomies.
type.definition: Measures a rate of energy use or energy production and is equivalent to the use or production of energy during a period of time. I.e. a watt is the equal to one joule of energy per second.

type.requirement: Interoperable Taxonomy Architecture (ITA) initiative requirement for alignment of the EDINET, IFRS and US GAAP taxonomies.
type.definition: The length item type is a measure of distance.

type.requirement: Interoperable Taxonomy Architecture (ITA) initiative requirement for alignment of the EDINET, IFRS and US GAAP taxonomies.
type.definition: The memory item type is a measure of memory typically used in the IT industry.

type.requirement: SBR-NL request for regulatory agencies which prohibit monetary cents to be reported.
type.definition: The NoDecimalsMonetaryItemType is a restriction on the xbrli:monetaryItemType in that it does not allow cents on the monetary value.

type.requirement: SBR-NL request for regulatory agencies which prohibit negative monetary values to be reported.
type.definition: The nonNegativeMonetaryItemType is a restriction on the xbrli:monetaryItemType in that it does not allow negative values on the monetary value.

type.requirement: SBR-NL request for regulatory agencies which prohibit cents AND negative values to be reported.
type.definition: The nonNegativeNoDecimalsMonetaryItemType is a restriction on the xbrli:monetaryItemType in that it does not allow cents or negative values on the monetary value.

type.requirement: CDP, GRC, US-GAAP and FSD taxonomies have all found a need for fact content to be one of an defined but extensible set of QNames, each of which may be presented with different labels depending on language and other factors.
type.definition: enumerationItemType specializes QNameItemType. The content of a fact of this type MUST be a QName denoting an xbrl concept in the xbrli:item substitution group, and MUST be either (a) the target of an effective definition relationship having arc role http://www.xbrl.org/2013/item-enumerations OR (b) reachable via domain-member relationships in the DRS of that relationship.
